data.meta_description: ​EastEnders Episode 6358 Tuesday 10 October 2021 20:00 BBC One (Scotland) Devised by Julia Smith Devised by Tony Holland Written by Sophie Woolley Directed by Karl Neilson Series Producer: Sharon...
data.text:
​​​​​​Coronation Street

Episode 10451

Friday 08 October 2021

ITV/STV

20:30

Devised by Tony Warren

Writer: Susan Oudot

​Director: Ian Bevitt

Series Producer: Iain MacLeod

Zeedan hides his diry laundry. Hashim spells out exactly what he wants from Zeedan.

Kevin runs out of options. Tez pretends to Kevin that he caught sight of Abi weeks ago but didn't speak to her. Kevin leaves Abi a heartfelt voicemail, explaining how much he loves and misses her.

Summer wins Max round. At number 8 Coronation Street, Summer does her best to teach Max about atomic structure. When Summer uses a football pitch analogy, Max suddenly takes an interest and David listens, encouraged. Billy persuades Summer to sign up for a litter picking event that evening. In a bid to spend some time with her, Aadi reluctantly agrees he'll do it too.

Jaames is on the up. Impressed by James' plans, Aggie and Michael reckon he too should put himself forward for management coaching. An upbeat James returns home and reveals that Weatherfield County have agreed to let him do his coaching badges whilst continuing as a player. Aggie and Michael are thrilled for him.

Meanwhile, when Asha receives a text from Nat, the girl at college suggesting they meet up, she's delighted and tells Nina that she'd like her to come along too as she values her opinion.

Elsewhere, Leo joins Jenny and Daisy to sample some beers, but it is clear Daisy isn’t interested in him and making excuses, heads off to bed.

CAST

Sally Carman as Abi Franklin​

Vincent Ebrahim as Hashim Elamin

Jack P. Shepherd as David Platt

Daniel Brocklebank as Archdeacon Billy Mayhew

Vinta Morgan as Ronnie Bailey

Sue Devaney as Debbie Webster

Qasim Akhtar as Zeedan Nazir

Michael Le Vell as Kevin Webster

Joe Frost as Leo Thompkins

Sally Ann Matthews as Jenny Connor

Paddy Bevin as Max Turner

Harriet Bibby as Summer Spellman

Joe Duttine as Tim Metcalfe

Ryan Russell as Michael Bailey

Tanisha Gorey as Asha Alahan

Mollie Gallagher as Nina Lucas

Jack P. Shepherd as David Platt

Sair Khan as Alya Nazir

Nathan Graham as James Bailey

Stephen Lord as Tez Wyatt

Lorna Laidlaw as Aggie Bailey

Charlotte Jordan as Daisy Midgley

Adam Hussain as Aadi Alahan

Shelley King as Yasmeen Nazir

​​​​​​Coronation Street

Episode 10450

Friday 08 October 2021

ITV/STV

19:30

Devised by Tony Warren

Writer: David Proud

​Director: Ian Bevitt

Series Producer: Iain MacLeod

​

Introducing Vincent Ebrahim as Hashim Elamin

Zeedan dishes out his revenge. Alya is taken aback when Zeedan reveals he has hired a food van. Debbie is furious to find Zeedan & Alya selling half price curries from their food van parked outside Viaduct Bistro and threatens to report them. Zeedan is unnerved to find his father-in-law, Hashim, chatting to Yasmeen in Speed Daal.

Kevin plays dirty. Roy tentatively informs Asha that Nina seems willing to drop her vendetta against Corey. Unable to shake his doubts, Kevin gets in his car and tracks down Tez and spots him doing a drug deal. As Tez samples the goods from his drugs deal, Kevin edges nearer and snaps a photo on his phone. Kevin stands up to Tez, convinced he lied yesterday and has really seen Abi. Kevin orders Tez to tell him all he knows or he will send the incriminating photo to his probation officer.

Summer is becoming a Teacher's Pet. With class over, Daniel offers Max some extra help with his course work. But Max throws the offer back in his face, declaring William Shakespeare a waste of time. When Daniel mentions his concerns regarding Max, Summer offers to mentor him and Daniel reckons it's a great idea.

Meanwhile, James uses his bad experience for good. James calls the Weatherfield County PR team and pointing out the lack of black managers, suggests they should train some of their talented black players to become managers and lead the way for other clubs. His idea is well received and James is thrilled.

Meanwhile, when Asha reveals that she likes a girl she's met at college, Nina urges her to go for it.

Elsewhere, Leo goes into The Rovers and convinced he's got the hots for Daisy, Jenny urges her to chat to him and get to know him. To Daisy's annoyance, Jenny invites Leo to join them in sampling some beers for a singles' night she’s proposing to organise.

CAST

Simon Gregson as Steve McDonald

Joe Frost as Leo Thompkins

Danny Tomlinson as Dylan Brady

Vincent Ebrahim as Hashim Elamin

Shelley King as Yasmeen Nazir

Charlotte Jordan as Daisy Midgley

Adam Hussain as Aadi Alahan

Joe Duttine as Tim Metcalfe

Stephen Lord as Tez Wyatt

Rob Mallard as Daniel Osbourne

Harriet Bibby as Summer Spellman

Daniel Brocklebank as Archdeacon Billy Mayhew

Michael Le Vell as Kevin Webste

​Tanisha Gorey as Asha Alahan

Vinta Morgan as Ronnie Bailey

Qasim Akhtar as Zeedan Nazir

Sair Khan as Alya Nazir

Mollie Gallagher as Nina Lucas

Sally Ann Matthews as Jenny Connor

Jane Hazlegrove as Bernie Winter

David Neilson as Roy Cropper

Paddy Bever as Max Turner

Sue Devaney as Debbie Webster

Nathan Graham as James Bailey

​​EastEnders

Episode 6355

Monday 04 October 2021

19:35

BBC One

Devised by Julia Smith

Devised by Tony Holland

Written by Rebekah Harrison

Directed by Jane Ashmore

Series Producer: Sharon Batten

Executive Producer: Jon Sen

Senior Executive Producer: Kate Oates

​Bernie starts to worry about Rainie's strange behaviour.

Keegan makes a huge decision.

Bobby has an idea to help Martin.

Kirsty invites her mother Sandy for a chat despite Thomas' concerns that she will blow their cover.

Rainie's actions are worrying Bernie.

Meanwhile, realising Martin is struggling for money after Peter firing him, Bobby comes up with a plan to assist his cousin.

Elsewhere, Honey holds her ground when Suki pesters her, threatening to tell everyone about Jags.

Martha Cope as Sandy Gibson

Tanya Franks as Rainie Highway

James Bye as Martin Fowler

Brian Conley as Thomas "Rocky" Cotton

Clair Norris as Bernadette "Bernie" Taylor

Natalie Cassidy as Sonia Fowler

Lorraine Stanley as Karen Taylor

Clay Milner Russell as Bobby Beale

Zack Morris as Keegan Butcher-Baker

Emma Barton as Susan "Honey" Mitchell

Jaz Deol as Kheerat Panesar

Perry Fenwick as Billy Mitchell

Milly Zero as Kirsty "Dotty" Cotton

Shiv Jalota as Vinny Panesar

Jamie Borthwick as Jay Brown

Balvinder Sopal as Suki Kaur Panesar

Dayle Hudson as Peter Beale

Alfie Deegan as Liam Butcher

Liz Sweet as Marie Evans

​​​​​​Coronation Street

Episode 10449

Wednesday 06 October 2021

ITV/STV

20:30

Devised by Tony Warren

Writer: Steven Fay

​Director: Neil Alderton

Series Producer: Iain MacLeod

Introducing Angela Wityszyn as Teresa Miles

Introcucing Stephen Lord as Tez Wyatt

Introducing Bill Fellows as Stu Carpenter

Introducing Victoria Scowcroft as Barmaid

Kevin turns Amateur Detective. A frantic Kevin informs Weatherfield Police of Abi's disappearance but is shocked to get a notification from the bank of a £5,000 withdrawal from their joint Bank Account. Sickened by the thought of what Abi has taken it for, Kevin visits The Dog & Gun with a photo of Abi, asking the regulars if sh has been in. Discovering Sebastian's father, Tez, is in the bar he breaks the news of Sebastian's murder and explains his fears that Abi has turned back to drugs in her grief. Tez assures him that he hasn't seen or heard from Abi.

It's a no show at Speed Daal. As the local food critic arrives at Speed Daal, Alya and Yasmeen are puzzled that none of their bookings have shown up. A furious Zeedan guesses what has happened. Zeedan returns to Speed Daal with a homeless man, Stu in tow and explains he has arranged for all the uneaten food to be donated to Archdeacon Mayhew's Soup Kitchen.

Daniel puts a spring back into Summer's step. Aadi tackles Summer about her plagiarism. Embarrassed at being caught out, a flustered Summer flees, leaving Aadi worried he has blown it. Summer admits to Daniel that she copied her mentor's statement. Daniel insists her first one was great and Oxford University would be lucky to have her.

Meanwhile, Jenny chats to Leo, hoping to get him interested in Daisy. Leo reveals he is working on the sinkhole at number 8 Coronation Street so will be around for a while.

Elsewhere, Tim and Sally go to Viaduct Bistro for a Wedding Anniversary meal, but Tim is aghast when Fergus joins them, having been invited by Sally for another parking pow-wow.

CAST

Shelley King as Yasmeen Nazir
